intro: Micromeria cremnophila subsp. anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian micromeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Anatolia, this subspecies thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native range.
